chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:22 AM Defendant Marchelle L Allen in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Court addresses WCS non compliance report - missed appointments.  Attorney Sonderhouse presents statements as to the missed appointments.  Defendant to report to WCS after Court today to explain the situation that has been going on with her phone and get back on track with appointments.  Court will not modify bail and bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 05-10-2022
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key unless modified by the Department of Health and Human Services.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

04:12 PM Defendant Marchelle L Allen in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
